segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, A segment for the unique identification of the delivery schedule document, by means of its name and its number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation:
DTM, A segment specifying the date, and when relevant, the time/period of the beginning and ending of the validity period of the document. The DTM must be specified at least once to identify the Delivery Schedule document date.
The date/time/period segment within other Segment group should be used whenever the date/time/period is logically related to another specified data item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments giving references relevant to the whole message, e.g. contract number.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents relating to the whole Delivery Schedule Message, e.g. contract, import/export license.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Date/time/period from the referred document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying names, addresses, locations, and contacts relevant to the whole Delivery Schedule.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation:
NAD, A segment for identifying names and addresses and their functions relevant for the whole Delivery Schedule. Identification of the seller and buyer parties is recommended for the Delivery Schedule message. Exception: the identification of the recipient of the goods must be given in the NAD segment in the detail section when required.
It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party ID should be specified, e.g. the buyer and seller are known to each other, thus only the coded ID is required. The consignee or delivery address may vary and would have to be clearly specified, preferably in structured format.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment indicating more details regarding specific place/locations related to the party specified in the NAD segment, e.g. internal site/building number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to identify people, functions, or departments and appropriate numbers to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify the person, function, or department to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation:
COM, A segment identifying communication types and numbers for the person, function, or department identified in the CTA.
4.1.2 Detail section
Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segment.name: Section control
segment.documentation:
UNS, A service segment placed at the start of the detail section to avoid segment collision.
The detail section consists of two main Segment groups:
Segment group 4 and Segment group 18. The use of one of the Segment groups assumes that the other group will not be used. There are two methods of conveying Product Delivery forecast information. First method is by delivery point (Segment groups 4-17), the second is product driven (Segment group 18-31).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group containing delivery names and addresses, related information and details of line items to be consigned to the delivery points.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation:
NAD, A segment for identifying names and addresses and their functions relevant to the delivery point.
All other segments in this segment group 4 following the NAD segment refer to that delivery point.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment identifying a specific location to which product, as specified in the LIN-Segment groups, should be delivered.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text in coded or clear form to give further clarification when required. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments providing information relating to documents required for the delivery point.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment providing information relating to the documents required for the specified delivery point.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Date/time of documents required.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to identify a person or department and appropriate numbers to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify the person, function, or department to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, Identify communication types and numbers for the person, function, or department identified in CTA.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments specifying details of the mode and means of transport, and date/time of departure and destination relating to specified delivery point.

segment.name: Details of transport
segment.documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the carriage, and the mode and means of transport of the goods for the specified transport.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date/time/period details of departure and/or arrival relating to the TDT segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: SG9-SG10-SG11-SG12-SG14 A group of segments providing details of the individual line items for the specified delivery point.

segment.name: Line item
segment.documentation: LIN, A segment identifying the details of the product or service to be delivered, e.g. product identification. All other segments in the detail section following the LIN segment refer to the line item.

segment.name: Additional product id
segment.documentation: PIA, A segment providing additional product identification.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment for describing the product or the service to be delivered. This segment should be used for products that cannot be identified by a product code or article number.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment specifying physical measurements of the item to be delivered in original or unpacked form.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that the line item is subject to special conditions due to origin, customs preference, or commercial factors.

segment.name: Goods identity number
segment.documentation: GIN, A segment providing identity numbers to be applied to the goods to be delivered, e.g. serial numbers for assembled equipment.

segment.name: Related identification numbers
segment.documentation: GIR, A segment providing sets of related identification numbers for a line item, e.g. engine number, chassis number and transmission number for a vehicle.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment identifying a specific location to which products, as specified in the LIN-Segment group, should be delivered.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Date/time/period associated with the line item.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text in coded or clear form to give further clarification, when required, to the line item to be delivered. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments to identify the person, function or a department and appropriate numbers to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify the person, function, department to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, Identify communication types and numbers for the person, function, or department identified in the CTA.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments giving references related to the line item and where necessary, their dates.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for identifying documents relating to the line item, e.g. a contract and its appropriate line item.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Date/time of the referred document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments specifying details of the mode and means of transport, and date/time of departure and destination relating to the specified location.

segment.name: Details of transport
segment.documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the carriage, and the mode and means of transport of the goods for the specified location.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date/time/period details of departure and/or arrival relating to the TDT segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments specifying quantity related information for actual delivery, reporting or cumulative quantities and forecast quantities as required for the line item.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to specify pertinent quantities which may be relating to schedule(s) and/or pattern established in the SCC/DTM segment, e.g. delivery quantity or a specified date.

segment.name: Scheduling conditions
segment.documentation: SCC, A segment specifying the type and status of the schedule being given, and optionally defining a pattern to be established, e.g. firm or proposed delivery schedule for a weekly pattern.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date/time/period details relating to the quantity and schedule details in the QTY/SCC segments. This segment may indicate date/time ranges, e.g. start and end dates for a delivery pattern, or delivery window.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments for referencing specific product delivery release information and where necessary their date.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing specific product delivery release information e.g. appointment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Date/time of the referred document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments identifying the packaging, physical dimensions, and marks and numbers for goods referenced in the line item to be delivered.

segment.name: Package
segment.documentation: PAC, A segment specifying the number of package units and the physical type of packaging for the line item, e.g. pallet.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment specifying physical measurements of packages described in the PAC segment, e.g. pallet dimensions.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to specify pertinent quantities relating to the physical units (packages) described in the PAC segment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying date/time/period details relating to the physical units (packages) described in the PAC segment, e.g. packaging date.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments identifying markings and labels and if relevant package numbers.

segment.name: Package identification
segment.documentation: PCI, A segment specifying markings and labels used on individual physical units (packages) described in the PAC segment.

segment.name: Goods identity number
segment.documentation: GIN, A segment providing identity numbers to be applied to the packages to be delivered.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments specifying details regarding quantity variations relevant to the line item to be delivered.

segment.name: Quantity variances
segment.documentation: QVA, A segment specifying details relating to variations between ordered/notified and shipped/received quantities.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time/period related to the variance specified in QVA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments for referencing quantity variance information.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents relating to the variance specified in QVA segment, e.g. previous delivery schedule, previous despatch advice.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Date/time of the referred document.

segmentGroup.documentation:
Segment group 18: SG20-SG22-SG24 The detail section consists of two main Segment groups, Segment group 4 and Segment group 18. The use of Segment group 18 assumes that Segment group 4 has not been used.
A group of segments that contains a line item and its related information and details of delivery names and addresses for each delivery location to which goods from the line items should be consigned.

segment.name: Line item
segment.documentation: LIN, A segment identifying the details of the product or service to be delivered, e.g. product identification. All other segments in the detail section following the LIN segment refer to the line item.

segment.name: Additional product id
segment.documentation: PIA, A segment providing additional product identification to the line item.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment for describing the product or the service to be delivered. This segment should be used for products that cannot be identified by a product code or article number.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment specifying physical measurements of the item to be delivered in original or unpacked form.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that the line item is subject to special conditions due to origin, customs preference, or commercial factors.

segment.name: Goods identity number
segment.documentation: GIN, A segment providing identity numbers to be applied to the goods to be delivered, e.g. serial numbers for assembled equipment.

segment.name: Related identification numbers
segment.documentation: GIR, A segment providing sets of related identification numbers for a line item, e.g. engine number, chassis number and transmission number for a vehicle.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Date/time/period associated with the line item.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text in coded or clear form to give further clarification, when required, to the line item to be delivered. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segment giving references related to the line item and where necessary, their dates.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents relating to the line item, e.g. a contract and its appropriate line item.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Date/time/period associated with the referred document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments specifying quantity related information for actual delivery, reporting or cumulative quantities and forecast quantities as required for the line item.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to specify pertinent quantities which may be relating to the schedule(s) and/or pattern established in the SCC/DTM segment, e.g. delivery quantity on a specified date.

segment.name: Scheduling conditions
segment.documentation: SCC, A segment specifying the type and status of the schedule being given, and optionally defining a pattern to be established, e.g. firm or proposed delivery schedule for a weekly pattern.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date/time/period details relating to the quantity and schedule detail sin the QTY/SCC segments. This segment may indicate date/time ranges, e.g. start and end dates for a delivery pattern, or delivery window.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 21: A group of segment for referencing specific product delivery release information and where necessary their date.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing specific product delivery release information, e.g. appointment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Date/time of the referred document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 22: A group of segments identifying the packaging, physical dimensions, and marks and numbers for goods referenced in the line item to be delivered.

segment.name: Package
segment.documentation: PAC, A segment specifying the number of package units and the physical type of packaging for the line item, e.g. pallet.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment specifying physical measurements of packages described in the PAC segment, e.g. pallet dimensions.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to specify pertinent quantities relating to the physical units (packages) described in the PAC segment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time/period details relating to the physical units (packages) described in the PAC segment, e.g. package validity date.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 23: A segment identifying markings and labels and ,if relevant, package numbers.

segment.name: Package identification
segment.documentation: PCI, A segment specifying markings and labels used on individual physical units (packages) described in the PAC segment.

segment.name: Goods identity number
segment.documentation: GIN, A segment providing identity numbers to be applied to the packages to be delivered.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 24: A group of segments providing details of the individual delivery points.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation:
NAD, A segment for identifying names and addresses and their functions relevant to the delivery point. Exception: the identification of the recipient of the goods must be given in the NAD segment in the detail section when required.
It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party
ID should be specified, e.g. the buyer and seller are known to each other, thus only the coded ID is required. The consignee or delivery address may vary and would have to be clearly specified, preferably in structured format.
All other segments in this Segment group 24 following the NAD segment refer to that delivery point.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment identifying a specific location to which products, as specified in the LIN-Segment groups, should be delivered.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text in coded or clear form to give further clarification when required. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 25: A group of segment providing information relating to documents required for the delivery point.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment providing information relating to the documents required for the specified delivery point.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Date/time of documents required.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 26: A group of segments to identify a person or a department and appropriate numbers to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify the person, function, or department to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, Identify communication types and numbers for the person, function, or department identified in CTA.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 27: A group of segments specifying quantity related information for actual delivery, reporting or cumulative quantities and forecast quantities as required for the delivery point.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to specify pertinent quantities which may be relating to the schedule(s) and/or pattern established in the SCC/DTM segment, e.g. delivery quantity on a specified date.

segment.name: Scheduling conditions
segment.documentation: SCC, A segment specifying the type and status of the schedule being given, and optionally defining a pattern to be established, e.g. firm or proposed delivery schedule for a weekly pattern.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date/time details relating to the quantity and schedule details in the QTY/SCC segments. This segment may indicate date/time ranges, e.g. start and end dates for a delivery pattern, or delivery window.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 28: A group of segment for referencing specific product delivery release information and, where necessary, their dates.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing specific product delivery release information e.g. appointment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Date/time of the referred document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 29: A group of segments specifying details regarding quantity variations relevant to the line item and delivery point to be delivered.

segment.name: Quantity variances
segment.documentation: QVA, A segment specifying details relating to variations between ordered/notified or shipped/received quantities, or to provide information on the latest received quantities.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time/period related to the variance specified in QVA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 30: A group of segments for referencing quantity variance information.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents relating to the variance specified in QVA segment, e.g. previous delivery schedule, previous despatch advice.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Date/time of the referred document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 31: A group of segments specifying details of the mode and means of transport, and date/time of departure and destination relating to the specified location.

segment.name: Details of transport
segment.documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the carriage, and the mode and means of transport of the goods for the specified location.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation:
DTM, A segment indicating the date/time/period details of departure and/or arrival relating to the TDT segment.
4.1.3 Summary section
Information to be provided in the Summary section:

segment.name: Section control
segment.documentation: UNS, A service segment placed at the start of the summary section to avoid segment collision.

segment.name: Control total
segment.documentation: CNT, A segment by which control totals may be provided by sender for checking by the receiver.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text in coded or clear form to give further clarification when required. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.
